alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 9:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Florida, including the following county, Lower Keys in Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Chica, Big Coppitt Key, Geiger Key and Shark Key. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Excessive heavy rainfall will cause significant ponding of water in low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. If you observe flooding, contact your Key West National Weather Service office at 3 0 5...295...1 3 1 6...extension 3.
